intro: Galium pycnophyllum, commonly known as the dense-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium pycnophyllum typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
